title: cassiopeia_(constellation)
body:
Cassiopeia is a [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. It is named after the queen Cassiopeia, mother of Andromeda, in Greek mythology. Its brightest star is Schedar.

Cassiopeia is an easily recognizable constellation. Its five bright stars form a slightly irregular letter W (or M).

title: corvus_(constellation)
body:
Corvus (the [[Crow]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. Its brightest star is Gienah.

Corvus has a shape of a quadrilateral, often with a short line attached to one corner.

title: tomoki_nakamoto
body:
[[Full Service (Mazjojo)|Full Service]] main and playable character.

A workaholic accountant who works at Schwarz Bank. He generally seems uninterested in anything other than his work. While sometimes snarky and dense about relationships between people, it seems he does genuinely want to have a romantic relationship.

title: sota_kobayashi
body:
[[Full Service (Mazjojo)|Full Service]] character.

A young, cheerful, and hyperactive masseur. He studies at Morningwood University during the day and works as a masseur for Full Service Spa at night. After his father abandoned them years ago, Sota became the pri- mary breadwinner of his family, car- ing for his sick mother and providing for his numerous younger siblings. He takes his job at Full Service very seriously and is willing to do any- thing to try to improve as a masseur and make more cash.

title: sawabe_yuu
body:
Members of the Japanese comedy duo HARAICHI.
HARAICHI is a popular Japanese comedy duo (manzai) consisting of two members: [[Sawabe Yuu]] and [[Iwai Yuuki]]. The duo was formed in 2006 and is known for their witty banter and unique style of humor that often incorporates rapid-fire dialogues and observational comedy.

title: vivian_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018537

Voice of [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]]. Notable for being Chinese, originally from Shanghai but living in Tokyo. To distinguish her, the [[People's Republic of China flag]] is drawn on her hat instead of the usual spiral. 

One of the better voice actresses, often said to be better at Japanese than most of the native speakers causing her to win the audition. Mostly appears as a Yuyuko stand-in, paired with [[Eska (cookie)|]] as the Youmu stand-in. Still active on "BiliBili":[https://space.bilibili.com/1433840/] as a [[virtual youtuber]].

title: eska_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018473
Voice of [[Konpaku Youmu]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]] and Kasu☆. Known for being one of the youngest of the voice actresses. While initially mildly popular, her fame waned as time went on and was replaced by the RIM family, UDK family, and ALC faction.

One frame of her running with a [[wheel o feet]] and swinging her [[katana]]s with [[afterimage]]s making it look like she had 6 arms became popular. Other than that, she is paired with [[Asatsuki (cookie)|]] usually as the younger companion.

title: sakuranbou_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018374

Voice of [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]]. Almost always drawn as [[muscular female|extremely muscular]] because of the MMD model she used. 

Despite her appearance, she is usually depicted as the most innocent of all of the Alices, blushing or hiding from anything lewd due to her lines in the voice drama. Sometimes seen as a sparring partner for [[Kanna (cookie)|]] or interested in [[Rei (cookie)|]]-kun, but is normal other than that.

title: yuwo_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018364

Voice of [[Shameimaru Aya]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]] and [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] in Halloween☆. Almost exclusively drawn as Aya because of how quickly she deleted her personal accounts, leading to her nickname as "Cookie's fastest woman".

Her speed left almost nothing for running jokes, so she is mostly just a stand-in for Aya.

title: rei_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018311 

Voice of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]] and [[Onozuka Komachi]] in Halloween☆. Typically portrayed in her kaoru式 MMD model which is based on Forbidden Scrollery's Marisa, wearing a [[black coat]] with [[buttons]], [[black gloves]], a [[petticoat]], and a [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow]]. Extremely commonly depicted as a [[genderswap (ftm)|male]] [[crossdressing]] [[otoko no ko]] due to her husky voice.

Despite having a similar voice to [[Azusa (cookie)|]] and [[Mars (cookie)|]], she is far worse at singing which became popular in its own way. 

Because of how often Rei is depicted as male, identifying their gender solely based on the image can be difficult or impossible. If the artist has tagged the image or written commentary with RIくん or RI君, then they are a male. Other hints can be: [[Sananana (cookie)|]] creeping on them, the artist drawing Rei as male in previous images, or the comments on the image. If there is absolutely no indication of Rei being male, then tag them as female.

title: sananana_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018214
* !asset #21018215

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S3]] and [[Komeiji Koishi]] in Nabe☆. Drawn with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. Very often drawn as a [[magical girl]] wearing a pink version of Reimu's clothes or as an [[office lady]]. Very rarely drawn with [[long hair]] and long [[sidelocks]]. The number 3777 can be shortened to her name, so sometimes appears too.

While initially unpopular, the 2014 boom of the RIM Family of her, [[Benikurage (cookie)|]], [[Kanna (cookie)|]], [[Reu (cookie)|]], and [[Yamin (cookie)|]] gradually increased her standing. This led to her characterization in fan art and media to be almost entirely disconnected from both her appearance in the voice dramas and any information about her real life.

A false rumor of her being 27 years old stuck and led her to being depicted as an embarrassing woman who dresses up in costumes and pretends to be a high-schooler to fit in with the other voice actresses. This was perpetuated by her saying she was "in her 20s" and doing an audio recording of a middle-schooler magical girl/idol. Another copypasta had her sexually attracted to dolphins, particularly [[Kairu the Dolphin]] of [[Microsoft Office]]. Her age also means she is drawn with [[pubic hair]] and [[armpit hair]] which later contributed to [[Shiromiya Rei]]'s association. Also commonly paired with [[Rei (cookie)|]]-kun, as a sort of [[onee-shota]] relationship.

title: suzuki_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018197

A [[NEET]] from Toyohashi who threatened to burn [[Kanna (cookie)|]] alive for incorrectly portraying [[Hakurei Reimu]]. 

For more information: https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2014-06-16/police-arrest-man-who-threatens-woman-because-of-touhou-project-voice-over/.75608

title: kochiko_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018145

Voice of [[Koakuma]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. According to the comments at the time, she had a "fat voice" so is usually drawn [[plump]] or [[fat]]. Compounded by when she first introduced herself, people thought she called herself "Pojiko". 

Despite her knowing of being called fat, she decided not to care and continue releasing singing videos. This gained her respected as a heroic and fearless voice actress. Other than that, she is drawn as a companion to the more generic [[Yuzuyu (cookie)|]]'s Koakuma, sometimes with [[fake wings]] on a [[hairband]].

title: yuno_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018108

Voice of [[Flandre Scarlet]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. Her and [[Sakura (cookie)|]]'s stuffy voices have them called the Nose Celebrity Sisters. Often called Sakura "Sakura-oneesama".  

One of the youngest voice actresses being around 13 years old, so her bad acting and singing is usually forgiven. She nicknamed herself YUNO-kun, which later gave rise to [[Rei (cookie)|]] being given the same suffix after she overshadowed Yuno.

title: sakura_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018070

Voice of [[Remilia Scarlet]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. Her and [[Yuno (cookie)|]]'s stuffy voices have them called the Nose Celebrity Sisters. Disappeared from the internet after she got married and had children.

While normally an unremarkable member of the cast, one particular image has single-handedly kept her popular:
* !asset #21018090
This is the most viewed, most parodied, and most commented Cookie image on the entirety of NicoSeiga. Nicknamed Deri-Sakura, this extremely poorly drawn image has become Sakura's entire legacy. It is commonly hidden in the background of other Cookie images or has other characters posing the same way. Sometimes it is drawn as Sakura's sister or a creation of hers that has come to life.

title: aika_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018027
* !asset #21018029

Voice of [[Izayoi Sakuya]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]] and [[Inaba Tewi]] in Cookie☆☆ S3. Drawn with purple-ish hair as Sakuya, but not always.

Had one of the calmest reactions to her Cookie popularity spike and stayed on relatively good terms with the rest of the cast including [[Taisa (cookie)|]]. Mostly is drawn as a companion to the other Sakuyas or as the Tewi to [[Hisui (cookie)|]]'s Reisen.

title: kurikinton_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21018017

Voice of [[Cirno]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. No notable deviations from Cirno's default appearance.

While her acting was subpar, she was a [[mua_(tatarauramesiya)|far better artist]]. She also had a stalker, [[Jyu (cookie)|]]. Another voice actor named [[ANNYUI (cookie)|]] was thought to have similar voice, so they are drawn together.

title: kanna_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017868
* !asset #21017904

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S2]]. Drawn with [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes|eyes]], with her distinct [b]~[/b] shaped [[blush]]es. Her stated height is 172cm, so she is drawn taller and with [[large breasts|larger breasts]] than the other Reimus. Her angry mother-like voice and attitude also has her appear as the mom figure to [[Yamin (cookie)|]] and [[Benikurage (cookie)|]]. Her voice also has her drawn as the most combative Reimu, with a [[dark persona]] that she fights.

She initially hated the attention that Cookie gave her, especially after her stalker [[Suzuki (cookie)|]] made national headlines when he was arrested for threatening to burn her alive. However, she warmed back up to Cookie after a few years, and has since become an [[Indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber]] in a [[miko]] costume. 

h4. External Links
* Her channel: https://www.youtube.com/@KANNA_CH

title: taisa_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017724
* !asset #21017725
* !asset #21017726
* !asset #21017727

Director of the [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ trilogy]], voicing [[Patchouli Knowledge]], [[Alice Margatroid]], [[Yakumo Yukari]], and [[Yagokoro Eirin]] but mostly appears in fan art as Patchouli or Alice. Almost always drawn [[smoking]] a [[cigarette]] and with [[sharp teeth]] across all her appearances. Never wears a hat as Patchouli, a [[collared capelet]] and no frills as Alice. Rarely associated with [[tentacles]] too.

Known for being [[yuri|in a relationship]] with [[Mars (Cookie)|]] after they met at voice acting school. Usually drawn as [[flat chest|flat]] compared to Mars. In fanworks, she appears as an unscrupulous yet charismatic director who is willing to sell the voice actors for fame.

title: sponge_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017820

Voice of [[Morichika Rinnosuke]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S1]], one of the very few male voice actors.

Considered one of the best voice actors, but mostly used as a stand-in for Rinnosuke when needed.

title: paseri_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017793

Voice of [[Kochiya Sanae]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S1]]. Typically drawn with [[facepaint|facepainted]] [[cross]] marks resembling ＋⌒o⌒＋, an emoji for Suwako, as in the fan MMD video.

One of the more unimportant characters, mostly being used as a stand-in for Sanae. Sometimes drawn as a daycare worker or kindergarten teacher.

title: ryuuga_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017783

Voice of [[Izayoi Sakuya]] in [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S1]]. Usually drawn with [[purple hair]] and [[glasses]] of some color.

Despite appearing in one of the most popular voice dramas, she lacks running jokes or information. This lack of public interest has been compared to [[Majime-kun]], as her one gag.

title: collared_capelet
body: A [[capelet]] with a collar.

title: kirara_jump
body:
[i]"Any anime where they jump in the OP is a god-tier anime."[/i] -- [[Yamada Ryo]], [i][[Bocchi the Rock!]][/i]

A jumping scene common in the openings of animated adaptations of [i][[Manga Time Kirara]][/i] manga. The scene usually involves the main cast (typically a cast of 3 or 4) [[holding hands]] and jumping against a [[blue sky]], with each character's primary traits displayed in their jumping style.

title: benikurage_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017649

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S1]]. Has [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]] with a noticeable [[parted bangs|center part]]. Mostly seen with her [[orange scarf|orange]] and [[red scarf|red]] [[striped scarf]] and [[red mittens]]. In real life she has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]]. Is probably [[Kakinota Neina]] too.

Since mentioning in some of her streams that her father tried to put a stray [[cat]] as part of nabe and that she burned the Quran (if these statements are true is unknown), fans have associated her with cats and Islamism. She has has a minor running joke of having a coating on her tongue. 

Typically portrayed in the [[Forbidden Scrollery]] style MMD model by Montecore.

title: leina_(queen's_blade)
body:
[b]Leina[/b] (レイナ) is a [[Queen's Blade]] character and the main character of the OVA anime. Voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]], designed by [[Hisayuki Hirokazu]]. A heir apparent of the noble Vance family. She is the older sister of [[Elina (queen's blade)|]] and half younger sister of [[Claudette (queen's blade)|]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and wears metal rings in her braids. She fights with a sword and shield. In [[Queen's Blade Unlimited]], her hair and bangs were [[long hair|noticeably lengthened]].

Leina's (Exiled Warrior) combat book: pool #767 

h4. Variations 

* [[exiled_warrior_leina|Leina (Exiled Warrior)]]
* [[phantom_warrior_leina|Leina (Phantom Warrior)]]

title: journey_-_taiko_arabia_hantou_de_no_kiseki_to_tatakai_no_monogatari
body: [b]The Journey[/b] is a 2021 a anime movie made by Toei Animation. A co-production between Japan and Saudi Arabia, the anime is a loose adaptation of a famous moment in [[Islam]], [i]The Year of the Elephant,[/i] when Abraha of the Aksumite kingdom attempted to invade the city of Mecca and destroy the [[Kaaba]]. The movie follows Aus, a former thief turned potter, who joins a small army to defend his home from Abraha's army.
other_names: ジャーニー_太古アラビア半島での奇跡と戦いの物語

title: kikou-kai_galient
body:
機甲界ガリアン ([b][i]Kikou-Kai Galient[/i][/b] / [i]Kikōkai Garian[/i]), also known as [b][i]Panzer World Galient[/i][/b], is a 1984 [[Japan]]ese [[science_fiction|sci-fi]] and [[fantasy]] anime [[super robot]] show focusing on ancient super technology [[mecha]]s in a [[medieval]]-looking planet.

The anime TV series was produced by [[Sunrise (company)]]. It was broadcast on [[nippon_tv|Nippon Television]] from October 5, 1984 to March 29, 1985.

The "show's opening":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8UjsH5xCC1E and "ending":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kNNNjLvyiOE musical themes were composed and performed by EUROX, a Japanese progressive rock band formed in 1984 in Tokyo, Japan. 

h4.Characters

* [[Jordy Volder]] / Joedy-Vorder / JoJo
* [[Chururu]] / Churuee

* [[azubes_(galient)|Azubes]]

* [[Hilmuka]]  / Hilmocha


* [[Mardal]] / Mardoul
* [[Hei Schaldat]] / Schaltat / High-Schultatte

h4.Mechas

(These giant mechs are called 機甲兵, Kikou-hei / Panzer Swords)

* [[Galient]], Panzer Sword
** [[Assault Galient]]

* [[Wingal Zee]], Panzer Gust Leader
* [[Twingal]], Panzer Gust Carrier
* [[Promaxis]], Panzer Trampler

title: waai_fu_(arknights)
body:

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

A university student from Lungmen and a member of [[Lee (Arknights)|]]'s Detective Agency with [[Aak_(Arknights)|Aak]] and [[Hung_(Arknights)|Hung]]. She is serving Rhodes Island from the first batch of employees hired under a secret Lungmen-Rhodes Island commercial agreement. A practitioner of Wing Chun martial arts, which she often uses on the battlefield.

Her motif is based on [[Tiger girl|tigers]].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kobayashi Yuu]].

title: sports_bra
body:
A sports bra is basically a tight-fitting [[tank top]] with the bottom half [[crop top|cut off]], exposing the [[midriff]]. Despite its name, it is typically not considered [[underwear]]. It is intended for wear during vigorous exercise that might cause the [[breasts]] to move uncomfortably or excessively, preventing discomfort and [[wardrobe_malfunction|potential embarrassment]] during exercise.

title: cross-shaped_pupils
body:
When a character's pupils are shaped like a + or †.

Do not confuse with [[+ +]] or [[x x]], which are specifically for eyes that shine in excitement or "dead eyes" respectively. Cross-shaped pupils are for characters with default/natural + or † pupils.

title: star-shaped_pupils
body:
When a character's pupils are shaped like a [[star (symbol)|star]]. This tag is only for when the entire pupil is shaped like a star, use [[star in eye]] for cases where there is a star present inside the eyes.

When indicating eyes lighting up in excitement, use [[+ +]] instead.

Do not confuse for [[cross-shaped pupils]] or [[diamond-shaped pupils]].

title: lamellar_armor
body:
[[Armor]] made from small perforated rectangular plates (lamellae) of metal, leather or bone laced into horizontal rows. Lamellar armor was used over a wide range of time periods in Central Asia, Eastern Asia (especially in China, Japan, Mongolia, and Tibet), Western Asia, and Eastern Europe.

Do not confuse with [[scale armor]]; lamellar armor is usually not attached to a leather backing (although, like most types of armor, it is typically worn over a padded undergarment).

h4. See also
* [[Scale armor]]
* [[Chainmail]]
* [[List of armor]]

title: tower_bridge_(london)
body:
An iconic Victorian [[gothic_architecture|Gothic]] bridge crossing the River Thames in [[London]], England. It has two tower sections connected by two sets of pedestrian walkways as well as having the "bascule":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bascule_bridge road deck, which can be raised to allow river traffic to pass through. It was named after the nearby Tower of London.

It played an important role in publicizing the [[2012 Summer Olympics]].

h4. See also

* "Tower Bridge Exhibition":http://www.towerbridge.org.uk/TBE/EN/
* Wikipedia: "Tower Bridge":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tower_Bridge

title: koshirae
body:
[[katana|Japanese sword]] mountings and fittings.

h5. Hilt and blade components
* [[tsuka (handle)|Tsuka]] (柄): sword handle.
** [[kashira (pommel)|Kashira]] (頭): end cap (pommel) on the end of the [i]tsuka[/i].
*** [b]Shitodome[/b] (鵐目): small metal collars in the [i]kashira[/i] and/or [i]kurigata[/i].
** [b]Samegawa[/b] (鮫皮): ray or shark skin used to cover the bare wooden handle.
*** [[Same-hada]] (鮫肌): literally the pattern of the ray skin (of [i]samegawa[/i]).
** [b]Tsukamaki[/b] (柄巻): way (pattern) of wrapping [i]tsuka-ito[/i] around the [i]tsuka[/i] ("see reference":https://www.touken-world.jp/tips/9966/#:~:text=柄巻の種類).
*** [[Tsuka-ito]] (柄糸): leather straps or woven cord used in the [i]tsukamaki[/i].
** [b]Mekugi[/b] (目釘): peg(s) for securing the handle to the blade.
*** [b]Mekugi-ana[/b] (目釘穴): hole(s) for the [i]mekugi[/i].
** [[Menuki]] (目貫): decorative metal fittings for the [i]tsuka[/i] (generally underneath the [i]tsukamaki[/i]; "see reference":https://www.touken-world.jp/tips/35070/).
** [[fuchi (hilt)|Fuchi]] (縁): hilt collar between the [i]tsuka[/i] and the [i]tsuba[/i].
* [[tsuba (guard)|Tsuba]] (鐔 or 鍔): sword guard.
** [b]Seppa[/b] (切羽): washers or spacers above and below the [i]tsuba[/i] to tighten the fittings.
* [[Habaki]] (鎺): blade collar.

h5. Scabbard components
* [[Saya (scabbard)|Saya]] (鞘): sword scabbard.
** [[Koiguchi]] (鯉口): mouth of the [i]saya[/i] or its fitting.
** [[Kurigata]] (栗形): [i]saya[/i] fitting for attaching the [i]sageo[/i].
*** [[Sageo]] (下げ緒): cord used for tying the [i]saya[/i] to the obi.
** [b]Kaeritsuno[/b] (返角): hook-shaped fitting used to lock the [i]saya[/i] to the obi while drawing.
** [[Kojiri]] (鐺): end cap on the end of the scabbard.
* [b]Kogai[/b] (笄): spike for hair and knot arrangements carried in a pocket of the [i]saya[/i], often paired with [i]kozuka[/i] ("see reference":https://www.touken-world.jp/wp/wp-content/themes/wp-templ/three-things/image/top/img-three-things-explanation.jpg).
* [b]Kozuka[/b] (小柄): decorated utility knife carried in a pocket of the [i]saya[/i], often paired with [i]kogai[/i] ("see reference":https://www.touken-world.jp/wp/wp-content/themes/wp-templ/three-things/image/top/img-three-things-explanation.jpg).

h4. External links
* "Touken World (JP): Koshirae part names":https://www.touken-world.jp/tips/10388/
* "Wikipedia: Koshirae":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_sword_mountings 
* "Wikipedia: Koshirae components (image)":https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/aa/Katana_%28common_shema%29.png

title: infinity_mirror

title: koishi_day
body: A day to celebrate [[Komeiji Koishi]] from [[Touhou]]. The 14th of May is considered Koishi day because the numbers 5-14 can be read as go-i-shi [五一四] (ko-i-shi). There is also an additional day dedicated to Koishi set to the 14th of June. The numbers 6-1-4 can be read as mu-i-shi which are the prefix for muishiki meaning "unconscious" or "unconsciousness". h4. See also * [[Cirno Day]] (9th September) * [[Kaguya Day]] (8th September) * [[Nazrin Day]] (20th July) * [[Satori Day]] (10th March) * [[Sekibanki Day]] (6th June) * [[SatoKoi day]]

title: androgyne_symbol
body:
The ⚨ symbol.

A mix of the [[mars symbol|mars]] (♂) and [[venus symbol|venus]] (♀) symbols.

It can be used to refer to characters that have an [[androgynous]] appearance, characters that are intersex/hermaphrodite/[[futanari]], or characters with a non-binary gender identity.

It can be shown pointing in any direction, and the direction is sometimes used to distinguish androgyne and intersex.

Closely related to and commonly interchanged with with the [[male-female symbol]] (⚥). Distinctly separate and not to be confused with the [[transgender symbol]] (⚧).

title: xion_(kingdom_hearts)
body:
No. XIV of [[Organization XIII]] in the [[KINGDOM HEARTS]] JRPG series.

Close friends with [[Roxas]] and [[Axel (Kingdom Hearts)|Axel]], and able to wield the [[Keyblade]].

[spoiler]True name is "No. i", part of the Replica Program to duplicate Sora (and Roxas's) mastery of the Keyblade. 

Her appearance is similar to Kairi because she is the [[personification]] from Sora’s memories of Kairi.[/spoiler] 

She has [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes]].
other_names: シオン(キングダムハーツ)

title: dark_young_(fate)
body:
[i]"Ankoku no Yagi"[/i]

A boss introduced in the Halloween 2021 event of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It appears as a giant [[goat]] with white fur on its upper body and black fur on its legs. Its coloration is extremely similar to the [[Chaldea Uniform]], so it is common to see either [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (male)|male]] or [[fujimaru ritsuka (female)|female Ritsuka]] [[cosplay|cosplaying]] as it.

title: volleyball
body:
A team sport in which two teams of six players are separated by a [[volleyball net]]. Each team tries to score points by grounding a ball on the other team's court under organized rules. It may be played on grass, sand, snow, or on an indoor court such as in a [[gym]].

[[Beach volleyball]] is a popular variant with two players per team and a slightly different set of rules.

h4.See also

title: pacific_racing_team
body:
A Japanese motorsport team, particularly known for their collaborations with anime and [[virtual youtuber]] copyrights. Starting in 2011, most Pacific [[racecar]]s feature distinctive [[itasha]] liveries with collaboration characters, with later liveries featuring the characters wearing Pacific's [[race queen]] outfits.

Pacific mostly competes in [[Super GT]] and the [[D1 Grand Prix]] [[drifting]] championship.

h4. Collaborative Copyrights
* [[Shinryaku! Ikamusume]] (2011-2012)
* [[Ghost in the Shell Arise]] (2013)
* [[Love Live! School Idol Project]] (2014-2015)
* [[Girls und Panzer]] (2015-2018)
* [[Mirai Akari Project]] (2019)
* [[Hololive]] (2022)
* [[VSPO!]] (2023-2024)

title: subaru_impreza
body:
Flagship [[car]] for [[Subaru (brand)|]]. 
Across all of its incarnations, the Impreza has always been deeply associated with the World Rally Championship, usually in the Subaru World Rally Team blue in contrast to its biggest rival, the usually Marlboro/Ralliart red [[mitsubishi motors|Mitsubishi]] [[mitsubishi lancer evolution|Lancer Evolution]]. 

[[Initial D]]'s [[Fujiwara Bunta]] owns a GC8 model Impreza WRX STi Coupé Ver. V (its anime installment being in Sonic Blue Mica, whereas the car is Gun Metal Gray in the manga), which he deems a "practical, everyday car".

title: kuromajo-san_ga_tooru!!
body:
黒魔女さんが通る!!, lit. [i]The Black Witch Appears!![/i] is a Japanese children's novel series written by Ishizaki Hiroshi and illustrated by [[Fujita Kaori]]. The series was launched on Kodansha's Aoi Tori Denki imprint from 1980, releasing 15 volumes during its run. A television anime adaptation by Shin-Ei Animation began airing in Japan from April 4, 2012.

Whilst joining her friends in an occult session to find out which girl a boy likes, [[Kurotori Chiyoko]] attempts to summon the messenger of love, Cupid. However, due to having a stuffed nose at the time, she inadvertently summons a black witch named [[Gyubid]], who decides to train Chiyoko to become a black witch herself.

h4. Characters

* [[Gyubid]]
* [[Ichiro Mai]]
* [[Kurotori Chiyoko]]
* [[Miyase Touko]]
* [[Mukai Rio]]
* [[Ramon Ruru]]
* [[Shion Megu]]
* [[Touka Blossom]]

h4. External links

title: qu_(all_tomorrows)
body:
Alien race from the speculative evolution novel [[all tomorrows|All Tomorrows]]. They are responsible for the myriad of posthuman species within the setting after a one-sided conflict against a spacefaring humanity.

They are thin, insectoid beings with four [[wings]], a long [[prehensile tail]], and a head with two stalked eyes and a mouth with [[mandibles]].

title: colonial_(all_tomorrows)
body:
One of the posthuman species in [[All Tomorrows]]. They were originally a human colony that had the most success fighting the [[Qu (all tomorrows)|]], being able to repel the Qu invasions twice before being defeated.

As punishment for their defiance, the Qu turned them into little more than sheets of skin and flesh that acted as filter feeders. To further their punishment, the Qu let them retain eyes and sentience so that they could fully experience their own suffering.

title: killer_folk
body:
One of the posthuman species in [[All Tomorrows]]. They are one of the species that rose after the [[Qu (all tomorrows)|]] left, evolving from the Human Predators.

They have animalistic features with [[fangs]] and [[spotted fur]]. Their thumbs became a hook-like claws while their last two digits were rotated perpendicularly to take its place as opposable digits.

title: temptor_(all_tomorrows)
body: One of the posthuman species in [[All Tomorrows]]. They are a species with extreme sexual dimorphism: the females are large, sessile, tree-like beings with a beak and half their bodies underground; the males are smaller, ape-like drones who are controlled by the females through vocalizations and pheromones.

title: lopsider
body: One of the posthuman species in [[All Tomorrows]]. They are flat, asymmetrical creatures that inhabit a planet with high gravity.

title: sternritter
body: The Sternritter (German for Star Knights) are a group of powerful [[Quincy (bleach)|]] in the [[Wandenreich]]'s army in the manga series [[Bleach]], debuting in the [[Bleach: Sennen Kessen-hen|Thousand-Year Blood War]] arc. They all wear variations of the [[Wandenreich uniform]].

title: zangetsu_(bleach)
body:
[[Kurosaki Ichigo]]'s Zanpakuto, manifesting as a tall man with [[facial hair]] and [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]], and wears [[sunglasses]] with a [[black coat]] that covers most of his body.

In Bankai form, he becomes a younger version of himself, with shorter hair, no facial hair, and no sunglasses.

[spoilers]During the [[Bleach: Sennen Kessen-hen|Thousand-Year Blood War]], it is revealed that the person formally identified as Zangetsu is in fact a manifestation of Ichigo’s Quincy powers, being a portion of [[Yhwach]]'s soul.[/spoilers]

title: chilchuck_tims
body:
Chilchuck is an [[halfling]] adventurer in [[Dungeon Meshi]]. He's one of the main protagonists, and handles locked doors and traps on the party's behalf. He has [[brown hair]], [[black eyes]], and wears [[leather armor]], [[black pants]], [[fingerless gloves]], and a green thing that is officially [i]not[/i] a scarf.

He has 3 daughters: [[Mayjack (dungeon meshi)|]], [[Fullertom (dungeon meshi)|]], and [[Packpatty (dungeon meshi)|]].

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/4469be82-0247-4302-a096-b9f932663fa2/1]

title: kurosawa_ruby
body:
One of the main characters of [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]. She frightens easily (and tends to emit a distinctive "pigii!" shriek), but loves school idols and always dreamed of becoming one. Ruby is the shy younger sister of [[Kurosawa Dia]], and a close friend with [[Kunikida Hanamaru]].

Ruby is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[cyaron! (love live!)|CYaRon!]], alongside [[Takami Chika]] and [[Watanabe You]].

She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[red hair|red]] [[two side up]].

Voiced by [[Furihata Ai]].

CYaRon!'s name is a combination of the initial letters of the sub-unit members' first names- "C" of Chika, "Y" of You, and "R" of Ruby

body:
When both of a character's hands are on another character's arms.

If a single hand is involved, use [[hand on another's arm]].

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on another's arm]], and if they are on both arms, use [[hands on another's arms]].

title: hands_on_another's_stomach
body:
When one character has both of their hands on someone else's abdominal region.

If there's only one hand on another's stomach, use [[hand on another's stomach]]
If a hand is on one's own stomach, use [[hand on own stomach]]
If both hands are on one's own stomach, use [[hands on own stomach]]

h4. See Also
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_another's_stomach
body:
When one character has one hand on someone else's abdominal region.

If both hands are on someone else's stomach, use [[hands on another's stomach]]
If a hand is on one's own stomach, use [[hand on own stomach]]
If both hands are on one's own stomach, use [[hands on own stomach]]

h4. See Also
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_own_stomach
body:
When a person has one of their hands resting upon their abdominal region.

If both hands are on their stomach, use [[hands on own stomach]]
If a hand is on someone else's stomach, use [[hand on another's stomach]]
If both hands are on someone else's stomach, use [[hands on another's stomach]]

h4. See Also
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_another's_chest
body:
One character is resting [b]both[/b] of their hands on someone else's chest, regardless if it's a male's chest or a female's [[breasts]].

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on another's chest]].

h4.See also

* [[covering another's breasts]]
* [[grabbing another's breast]]
* [[hands on own chest]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_another's_neck
body:
A less violent form of [[strangling]], where one person is gently resting both of their hands upon someone else's neck. This could be for affection, or to help them put on a piece of neckwear or a [[necklace]].

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on another's neck]].

h4. See also

* [[hands on own neck]]
* [[strangling]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hands_on_own_neck
body:
When a character has both of their hands on their own neck.

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on own neck]].

h1. See also
* [[hands on another's neck]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

title: hand_on_another's_neck
body:
When one character has one of their hands on another character's neck, whether it be on the nape of their neck at the back, or in the front.

If both hands are involved, use [[hands on another's neck]].

h4. See also

* [[hand on own neck]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

If only one hand is involved, use [[hand on own chin]].


h4. See also

* [[stroking own chin]]
* [[hand on another's chin]]
* [[Tag group:Hands]]

If the character has only one hand on one cheek, use [[hand_on_own_cheek]] instead.
If one character is placing their hands on someone else's cheeks, use [[hands_on_another's_cheeks]] instead.

h4. See also

title: mining_helmet
body: A type of [[hard hat]] worn specifically for [[mining]]. Can be distinguished from a regular [[hard hat]] by its inclusion of a [[headlamp]] to help illuminate caves.

title: headlamp
body:
A type of small [[flashlight]] (or other similar illuminating device) worn on the head to provide light while leaving the hands free. 

Often attached to a [[headband]] or [[hard hat]] (such as a [[mining helmet]]), but may also be affixed directly to the head.

title: two-tone_skin
body:
A [[colored skin]] that is two-toned (comprised of only two colors). Normally occurring colors like [[tan]], [[bruise]]s etc don't apply.

Both skin colors should be tagged, if possible.

h4. See also

* [[Multicolored Skin]]
* [[Gradient Skin]]
* [[Tag group:Skin Color]]

title: multicolored_skin
body:
When a character has two or more distinct colors making up their layer of skin. All skin colors present should be tagged, if possible.

This doesn't include naturally occurring differences in colors such as [[areolae]], [[nipples]], [[bruise]]s, [[tan]] and [[blush|blushing]] to name a few. At least one of the skin colors has to be [[colored skin|unnatural]] and the colors have to be visually distinct from each other. 

For instance, post #472760 has [[blue skin]] and [[red skin]] divided evenly on her flesh.

h4. See also
* [[two-tone skin]]
* [[Vitiligo]]

title: patchwork_skin
body:
For when a character has skin that has been stitched together in multiple places, possibly from multiple sources.

If the skin patches are differently colored, [[multicolored skin]] may apply as well.

h4. See Also
* [[Multicolored skin]]
* [[Two-tone skin]]

title: gradient_skin
body:
A specific type of [[multicolored skin]] where a character or person depicted has skin that blends and gradually changes from one color to one or more other colors.

All skin colors in the gradient should be tagged, if possible.

h4. See Also:

* [[Colored extremities]]
* [[Gradient]]
* [[Two-tone skin]]
* [[Tag group:skin color]]

title: open_hoodie
body:
A [[hoodie]] left [[unzipped]] or [[unbuttoned]].

If the wearer is naked underneath the hoodie, [[naked hoodie]] may apply as well.

h4. See also

* [[open clothes]]

title: open_kimono
body:
When the front of a [[kimono]] is opened up to reveal what is underneath.

If the wearer is naked underneath the kimono, [[naked kimono]] may apply as well.

title: open_cardigan
body:
A [[cardigan]] that is open and unbuttoned/unzipped.

If the wearer is naked underneath the cardigan, [[naked cardigan]] may apply as well.

title: open_jacket
body:
A [[jacket]] (of any kind) that is open and [[unbuttoned]]/[[unzipped]].

If the wearer is naked underneath the jacket, [[naked jacket]] may apply as well.

title: open_robe
body:
A [[robe]] that is unfastened, revealing the body underneath.

If the wearer is naked underneath the robe, [[naked robe]] may apply as well.

title: oshaka_(haguki)
body: Artist.

title: floating_clothes
body:
Clothing that is blowing in the [[wind]], floating in midair, or otherwise not being held down by gravity.

h4. See Also
* [[clothes lift]]

title: sena_(xenoblade)
body:
Main party member in [[Xenoblade Chronicles 3]]. Best friends with [[Mio (xenoblade)|]].

Has [[fiery hair]] worn in a [[side ponytail]].

title: convention
body:
An event where people share their love for some subject (Ex: animecon).

A popular event at anime conventions is the selling of [[doujins]] by various authors at the author’s respective tables, so if the image shows a table with doujins stacked on it, the author sitting on one side, and people lining up to buy them from the other side, the setting of the image is probably a convention.

title: object_namesake
body:
A type of [[pun]] when a character is paired with any kind of object or animal that makes a reference to their civilian or alter ego's name. For instance, 'Yuri/百合' means '[[lily (flower)|lily]]', so a character named Yuri holding a bouquet of lilies would qualify.

h4. Examples

* any character named Ringo and an [[apple]] ("ringo" means apple)
* any character named Sakura and [[cherry blossoms]] ("sakura" means cherry blossom)
* [[Ibuki Suika]] and a [[watermelon]] or [[watermelon bar]] ("suika" means watermelon)
* [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and a [[patchouli_(plant)|patchouli]]

title: voice_actor_connection
body:
A [[crossover]], [[cosplay]] or [[parody]] based on a character's [[voice actor]].

Most often, this is a character [[cosplay]]ing another character played by the same actor, or a [[crossover]] between multiple characters played by the same actor.

Other examples include:

* A character drawn with their voice actor.
* A voice actor cosplaying their own character.
* A character using mannerisms of their voice actor, or another character played by the same actor.
* A [[crossover]] between two characters played by related voice actors (by family or by marriage).
* A [[crossover]] between [[virtual youtuber]]s played by the same person.

When tagging the voice actor connection, please also tag the name of the [[voice actor]] referred to by the connection. Only include the [[voice actor]] tag if the actor him/herself is physically present in the image, or a character is cosplaying as the actor.

title: ushio_tetsu
body: The bully from the original [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] manga's first chapter who abused his power at school. He was the first victim of [[Yami Yugi]]. He lost to [[Muto_Yugi|Yugi]]'s dark personality in a Shadow Game, forcing him into a penalty. Somehow, he recovered from that and became a member of Sector Security in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's]].

title: delta_gundam_kai
body:
Prototype transformable [[mobile suit]] developed from the [[Delta Plus]] as a technology demonstrator. Contains the NITRO system, allowing non-Newtypes to use the pair of prototype [[Fin Funnels]] equipped on the machine. Its frame has been enhanced with extra thrusters, allowing it to fly both in space and in the atmosphere.

Armed with a shield that doubles as the Delta Kai's forward section in Waverider Mode; the shield also carries a pair of beam sabers that double as beam guns when transformed and a mounting section for a variety of experimental weapons.

A hand-held beam cannon called a "Long Mega Buster" rounds out its weapon loadout.

This suit appears in Mobile Suit [[Gundam Unicorn]]: UC 0094 - Across the Sky, the Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn video game and UC: MSV.

[b]NOTE:[/b] The HGUC kit contains extra parts from the Delta Plus mold, such as an extra Beam Rifle.

title: delta_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

[b]MSN-001 Delta Gundam[/b] 

A state-of-the-art (at the time) prototype transformable [[mobile suit]] from the [[Zeta Gundam]] era in the Universal Century. Has anti-beam coating and atmospheric flight capability. However, due to its transformation placing too much stress on the frame, it remained a prototype and simulator data -- what was supposed to be the Delta was later repurposed into a high-performance Mobile Suit -- the [[Hyaku Shiki]].

The concept of the Delta was later revisited after advances in mobile suit design made it feasible, resulting in the limited-run [[Delta Plus]] and [[Fin Funnels|Fin Funnel]] testbed [[Delta Gundam Kai]].

In a nod to its repurposing, the simulation of the Delta Gundam is based on the piloting data of [[Quattro Bajeena]], the pilot of the aforementioned Hyaku Shiki.

title: smithers_scared_of_strippers_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from a scene in [[The Simpsons]], season 13 episode 04 "A Hunka Hunka Burns in Love".

In the episode, [[montgomery_burns|Mr. Burns]] goes searching for a girlfriend with his assistant [[Waylon Smithers]]. They cluelessly enter a strip club before realizing what it is. As Burns turns to leave, he looks back and sees Smithers cornered by two strippers dancing teasingly at him. Smithers, a gay man, recoils and groans in horror.

h4. External link

* "The scene in Frinkiac":[https://frinkiac.com/caption/S13E04/379921]

title: selectovision_(meme)
body:
A political cartoon depicting one man brandishing a [[knife]] and chasing another, with a third man recording the two on a [[video camera]]. Through the video camera, it appears as though the man being chased is threatening the actual aggressor with a knife, reversing the reality of the situation. 

The original cartoon was a work by David Suter called Selectovision, published in 1985. Online, the image is often circulated with the text "It's Media" or "The Media Shows You What They Want".

h4. Original
* !asset #20983868: Selectovision (1985)

title: misato_(princess_connect!)
body:

title: ryouki_(senran_kagura)
body:
A character from [[Senran Kagura]], and one of the five new characters in [[Senran Kagura Estival Versus]].

She is the (formerly) deceased sister of [[Ryoubi (senran kagura)|]] and [[Ryouna (senran kagura)|]]. During the Estival Versus, she was revived by [[Syuri (senran kagura)|]] and her company during the special Kagura Festival.

When [[Ryoubi (senran kagura)|]] and [[Ryouna (senran kagura)|]] were younger, Ryoki would take care of them like any parent would. This is all that she would do, until she was enrolled into Gessen Girls' Academy. Afterwards, was sent on a mission to take on yoma, but died during that mission. It was later revealed that a yoma killed her, but until [[Rin (senran kagura)|]] had given her two younger sisters that information, they believed it was [[Miyabi (senran kagura)|]], who had killed everyone in a rampage, using the Forbidden Ninja Art: Blood Riot. However, the only one killed by Blood Riot was the yoma, everyone else died before the activation of the forbidden technique. In addition to her shotgun shield, she also uses her [[coffin]] as a weapon.

Since she hasn't been completely brought back to life per se, she still has a [[halo]] hovering over her head. She also derives much pleasure from hearing Buddhist sutras being told.

Her voice actress is [[Inoue Kikuko]].

h4. See Aslo
* "Kagurapedia: Ryouki":https://senrankagura.fandom.com/wiki/Ry%C5%8Dki

title: kagehira_mika
body:
[i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i] character. A second year student and member of [[valkyrie (ensemble stars!)|Valkyrie]]. 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[heterochromia]]. At school, he wears the standard [[yumenosaki school uniform|Yumenosaki uniform]], consisting on [[plaid pants]], a [[blazer]] with a [[sweater vest]] and a [[necktie]]. For Valkyrie, he wears a [[frilled jacket]] and a [[long coat]] with [[boots]].

He is very devoted to [[itsuki shu|Shu Itsuki]] because he called out to him when he was alone. But Shu ignores and belittles him in return. He has an honest and gullible personality, but can easily become lonely and broody. He likes cute and scary things, but has very few friends because he has difficulties finding people who share his interests. He has a complex about his girlish name and mismatched eyes. Mika has a heavy Osaka accent and has a lot of part-time jobs to support Valkyrie, since Shu doesn't like to deal with crowds.

[[anzu (ensemble stars!)|Anzu]] likes him because he resembles her friend [[kuromori suzu|Suzu Kuromori]]. Unfortunately, Mika tries to avoid her because Shu resents her for defeating Fine with Trickstar. They eventually became good friends, with Anzu befriending him the same way she did with Suzu in the past.

title: quality
body:
[tn]This term is properly spelt "QUALITY" (without the quotes), in ALL CAPS. This tag is written in lowercase due to limitations in Danbooru's tagging system.[/tn]

The term "QUALITY" indicates (with ironic intent) glaring yet humorous errors and flaws in commercial works of poor quality or works of otherwise good quality. This can be caused by poor budgeting (blowing most of the budget of an anime into the first episodes, per example), a small budget or outsourcing to cheaper studios, although it can also be as a result of a honest mistake.

The Japanese equivalent is "ヤシガニ" ("Coconut crab"), a reference to [[Lost Universe]]'s 4th episode which, due to the show's notoriously bad animation, was turned into a byword for bad animation in general. A more descriptive term is "作画崩壊" ("Animation collapse").

This tag can be applied to any posts that [i]intentionally[/i] recreates the disfigured art or animation frame for humorous purposes. Do [i]not[/i] apply this tag to any other post with generally poor quality otherwise. For posts featuring an error unintentionally created by an artist, see [[artistic error]].

h4. See also
* [[Anubis-kun]]
* [[cursed M4A1 (meme)]]
* [[Ecce Homo]]
* [[Mobile Suit Gundam: Cucuruz Doan's Island]]
* [[quality cabbage (meme)|]]
* [[running ganger (meme)]]
* [[Sader]]
* [[Takahashi Youichi (style)]]

title: kune-kune
body:
くねくね ([i]Kune-kune[/i], an onomatopoeia meaning "wiggle-waggle") is an [[urban legend]] that has been going around the Internet since 2003. In this scary story appears an unidentifiable being.

Although the story has a number of patterns, the most representative storyline is the one where "the narrator wanders around the countryside in the summer, near a paddy field or a river, and sees a white thing that wiggles its body in a manner far different from that of any person or living creature. He asks his companion what that thing might be. His friend uses binoculars in order to verify the actual shape of the thing, and as soon as he understands what it is, his mouth seizes up with fear and he becomes insane."

The locals know that "when you see the wiggle-waggle, once you understand what it is, it has an abnormal effect on your soul," and they regard it as taboo. In the stories, sometimes there can be a warning from the local elders who say "if you see such a thing, you should not get close; you should quickly forget you ever saw it."

Not to be mistaken for the visually similar [[Hattifattener]] from The [[Moomin]]s.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4.External Links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunekune_%28Yokai%29
* ”It’s better if you don’t know” "[Original Japanese]":[http://syarecowa.moo.jp/6/212.htm] "[English translation]":[http://sharekowa.tumblr.com/post/87647754633/its-better-if-you-dont-know] - The probable earliest origin of the stories, posted on a [[2channel]] thread in July 2001. At that time  the creature had no name.

title: remove_before_flight_tag
body: The “Remove Before Flight” tag is an integral safety sign for aircraft maintenance and notifies aircraft personnel that its attached component needs removal before use. The tags are checked during ground handling processes, usually as part of a standardized checklist. Failure to remove the tag and its attachment can result in terrible consequences ranging from a simple part failure to a complete aircraft shutdown.

title: paixiao
body:
Paixiao,a type of Chinese musical instrumen.

Chinese bamboo panpipe, generally a series of bamboo tubes secured together by rows of bamboo strips, wooden strips, or ropes. The instrument is blown across the top end. Although 16 pipes have become the standard, other groupings (from 13 to 24) have been made. Before the Tang dynasty (AD 618–907) the panpipe was called xiao.

title: strategic_cruiser_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft]] from the [[EVE Online]].
Versatile ships that can be reconfigured for a variety of [[Attack ship (EVE Online)|attack]], [[Combat ship (EVE Online)|combat]], disruption or support roles.

Strategic cruisers (also T3Cs) are the [[Tech 3 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 3]] variant of the [[cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s. They are the evolution of Sleeper technology into the currently known technology base. In practical terms, they are expensive, powerful, and extremely customizable cruiser-sized ships.
Strategic cruisers have four subsystem slots designed to create a single ship, each holding a part of the ship's basic layout and carrying its own set of bonuses. No strategic cruiser can be fielded if it lacks any of the four subsystem slots. Each race has developed its own set of subsystems for each ship, and these subsystems are not interchangeable between different races' strategic cruisers. Each subsystem has an associated skill, and when combined provide Strategic Cruisers with many more bonuses than any other ships.
To further improve their flexibility, strategic cruisers are also the only ships capable of having Rigs removed from them without destroying them, allowing a single strat cruiser hull to completely refit and change its role in a matter of seconds. To encourage on-the-fly reconfigurations (using a Mobile Depot for example), they also come with an extra cargo bay especially for storing subsystems. And to further encourage pushing the ships to their limits in the field, the main strategic cruiser skill itself does not provide direct combat bonuses, but instead reduces the overheat damage sustained by the ship's modules, and increases the speed of using Nanite Repair Paste to repair overheat damage.
It takes a lot of effort to build a strategic cruiser, and they consequently cost a lot. Most primary components of Tech 3 production are found in Wormholes, and some of the rarer gases and components are not available outside of Dangerous or Deadly Unknown systems.
The following are the strategic cruisers, by race:
* [[Amarr Empire (EVE Online)|]] [[Legion (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Caldari State (EVE Online)|]] [[Tengu (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Gallente Federation (EVE Online)|]] [[Proteus (EVE Online)|]]
* [[Minmatar Republic (EVE Online)|]] [[Loki (EVE Online)|]]

h5. External links: 
https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Strategic_Cruisers

title: corvette_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft|spaceships]] from the [[EVE Online]].
Starting ships given free of charge, suitable for interstellar travel.

Little more than slower, armed shuttles, corvettes (formerly known as "rookies", "rookie ships" or "noobships") are the basic ships that new pilots start with. You can acquire your faction's corvette by clicking the "Board my Corvette" button whenever you are docked. It will be fitted with a civilian weapon, a civilian mining laser, and a civilian afterburner. If you already have a corvette in that structure, you will board that one, and its fit will be the fit before you entered it. While corvettes aren't suited for serious combat, people field fleets composed entirely of corvettes, more for their comedy value than for their effectiveness in battle.

h5. External links: 
https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Corvettes

title: pirate_faction_(eve_online)
body:
A type of factions in the [[EVE Online]].

Non-Empire Faction ships are bought from non-empire faction loyalty point stores, including Pirate factions, and others, such as [[Servant Sisters Of EVE]]; and single-run blueprints for them can be found by destroying rare commander and sometimes tougher NPCs in certain combat sites. They can also be purchased second-hand from players on the market. These ships require two different races' Spaceship Command skills to use. For example, the Dramiel, an [[Angel Cartel (EVE Online)|]] [[frigate (EVE Online)|]], requires both [[Minmatar Republic (EVE Online)|Minmatar]] and [[Gallente Federation (EVE Online)|Gallente]] frigate skills. However, they do not require high levels in these skills, making them considerably easier to train for than [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|]]s. Non-Empire ships typically have equal or better performance to Tech 2 ships, including very powerful unique bonuses specific to their pirate faction, but also cost considerably more than Tech 2 ships and do not benefit from T2 resist bonuses.

title: battlecruiser_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft|spaceships]] from the [[EVE Online]].
Flexible fitting vessels that bridge the gap between [[cruiser (EVE Online)|]]s and [[battleship (EVE Online)|]]s.

Battlecruisers are larger, slower and have more slots than cruisers, but they're smaller than battleships and fit the same medium-sized weapons that cruisers use. They occupy a position between cruisers and battleships analogous to [[destroyer (EVE Online)|]]s' position between [[frigate (EVE Online)|]]s and cruisers, although battlecruisers are much more versatile and widely-used than destroyers. Most battlecruisers can mount Command Bursts, modules capable of giving significant bonuses to nearby allied ships. Tech 1 battlecruisers are the least character-skill-intensive and most accessible hull with this ability.
One group of [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|]]s, Command Ships, are based on battlecruiser hulls. Command Ships are more durable and dangerous versions of their Tech 1 base hulls, with space for more Command Bursts and bonuses to either the strength or the range of their bursts.

h5. External links: 
https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Battlecruisers

title: sleep_kirby

In this form, Kirby wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] or [[blue headwear|blue]] [[nightcap]] that comes decorated in [[polka dot headwear|polka dots]] and has a [[pom pom (clothes)|pom pom]] at its tip. Evolved Forms: * [[Deep Sleep Kirby]]

title: nejiri_hachimaki
body:
A type of [[hachimaki]] made of twisted cloth that is then tied around the head.

Commonly worn in ceremonies and festivals, such as the [[mizu happi]] worn by yamakasa carriers or [[taiko drum|taiko]] drummers. Chefs can also wear this type of hachimaki, but less often than their flatter counterparts.

Nejiri hachimaki implies [[hachimaki]], which itself implies [[headband]], which requires it to [b]cover the forehead[/b].

h6.Correct examples
* !post #6624392
* !post #5455347
* !post #6270132

h6.Incorrect examples
* !post #6651945: Does not cover her forehead

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: toy_hammer_kirby
body: An evolved form of [[Hammer Kirby]] in [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]]. Notably trades his usual hachimaki out for a [[blue helmet|blue]] [[helmet|bicycle helmet]] and wields a [[toy hammer]] in this form.

title: the_book_of_life
body:
From producer Guillermo del Toro and director Jorge Gutierrez comes an animated comedy with a unique visual style. THE BOOK OF LIFE is the journey of Manolo, a young man who is torn between fulfilling the expectations of his family and following his heart.

Before choosing which path to follow, he embarks on an incredible adventure that spans three fantastical worlds where he must face his greatest fears. Rich with a fresh take on pop music favorites, THE BOOK OF LIFE encourages us to celebrate the past while looking forward to the future.
other_names: ブック・オブ・ライフ
ブック・オブ・ライフ〜マノロの数奇な冒険〜

title: drill_kirby
body: A [[copy ability]] that appears in [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]] and [[Kirby's Dream Buffet]] which lets [[Kirby]] drill into the ground. When in this form, Kirby wear a [[brown headwear|brown]] [[two-tone headwear|and]] [[yellow headwear|yellow]] [[hard hat]] with a [[drill]] in its center and a clear [[visor]]. title: rakkun_sutaru
body:
A magical [[raccoon girl|raccoon/tanuki]] hybrid [[indie virtual youtuber|independent]] [[virtual YouTuber]] and former member of [[Owozu]].

h4. Appearance

She has [[raccoon ears]] and a [[raccoon tail]]. Her eyes are red. She also has a [[two-tone hair]] of [[short hair|short length]], whose colors are mainly [[brown hair|brown]], with [[red hair|red]] [[colored tips|tips]] and a frontal [[streaked hair|streak]]. She often wears a [[raccoon hat]], a [[bandaid on nose|nose bandaid]] and [[domino mask]]. 

As part of her redebut in Owozu, her eyes are [[multicolored eyes|multicolored]] with [[red eyes|red]] and [[blue eyes|blue]], and is sometimes depicted with red [[colored inner hair]].

h4. Costumes

As an indie, her original costume consists of a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[blue jacket]], worn over a [[white camisole]] and a [[black bra]], as well as [[black pants|black]] [[capri pants]] fastened with a [[fur-trimmed_belt |"tail belt"]]. She also wears [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]].

Under Owozu, her second costume (post #5448303) consists of a [s][[beige jacket|beige]][/s] and [[brown jacket]], worn over a [[white camisole]], a black underbust and [[black shorts|black]] [[high-waist shorts|high-waist]] [[short shorts]]. She also wears [[brown thighhighs]], [[black gloves]] and [[multicolored footwear|multicolored]] [[black footwear|black]] and [[green footwear|green]] [[platform footwear|platform shoes]].

Her third costume (post #7230708) consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]] [[cropped shirt]] accompanied by [[plaid arm warmers|plaid]] [[red arm warmers]] and a [[single bridal gauntlet|single]] [[fishnet bridal gauntlets|fishnet bridal gauntlet]]. Her bottomwear is composed of a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt]], fastened with a [[black belt]]. Her legwear is [[uneven legwear|uneven]] with a [[fishnet socks|fishnet]] [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]] held by a [[thigh strap]] and [[single garter strap|garter strap]]; a [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet]] [[single over-kneehigh|over-kneehigh]], and [[black footwear]].

h4. External Links
* "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/c/RakunVT] (main)
* "Twitch":[https://www.twitch.tv/rakkunvt]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Raakkun]
* "Virtual YouTuber Wiki":[https://virtualyoutuber.fandom.com/wiki/Rakkun_Sutaru]

title: 2017_central_mexico_earthquake
body:
The [b]2017 Central Mexico Earthquake[/b] struck at 13:14 CDT (18:14 UTC) on 19 September 2017 with an estimated magnitude of Mw 7.1 and strong shaking for about 20 seconds. It was epicentered about 55 km (34 mi) south of the city of Puebla. The earthquake caused damage in the Mexican states of Puebla and Morelos and in the Greater Mexico City area, including the collapse of more than 40 buildings.

Although Mexico's SASMEX earthquake warning system gave 20 seconds' advance notice in Mexico City, 342 people were killed throughout the region (including 203 in Mexico City), and more than 6,000 were injured.

Twelve days earlier, the even larger "2017 Chiapas Earthquake":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Chiapas_earthquake struck 650 km (400 mi) away, off the coast of the state of Chiapas, damaging many of the buildings that collapsed in the later September 19 earthquake.

The last quake coincidentally occurred on the 32nd anniversary of the "1985 Mexico City Earthquake":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1985_Mexico_City_earthquake , which killed around 10,000 people. 

The 1985 quake was being commemorated that day, and a national earthquake drill was held, at 11 a.m. local time, just two hours before the 2017 earthquake. According to experts "this coincidence actually may have saved thousands of lifes":http://www.euronews.com/2017/09/20/mexico-quake-evacuation-drill-may-have-saved-lives .

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Central_Mexico_earthquake

title: bokjumeoni
body:
A bokjumeoni or 복주머니 is a colourful traditional Korean silk [[pouch]] that is carried with a [[hanbok]] due to the latter's lack of pockets. It is believed to bring the holder good luck as suggested by its name which means 'Luck pockets/pouch'.

Nowadays the pouch is used as a gift bag to give small presents such as candy or money.

title: eileennoir
body:
Eileennoir is a Thai [[Indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[Virtual YouTuber]]. She is also a GL comic artist, and a former member of [[Algorhythm Project]] (being suspended on 22 April 2024, and then resigning on 11 May 2024).

Eileennoir is a nephilim, a combination between an [[angel]] and a [[demon]] with an appearance with [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her costume is composed of a [[white dress|white]] [[multicolored dress|and]] [[purple dress|purple]] [[sleeveless]] dress with a pair of [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]], a [[cleavage cutout]] showing her [[large breasts|ample]] [[cleavage|bosom]], a pair of [[gradient legwear|gradient]] [[white pantyhose|white]] and [[purple pantyhose]] and a pair of [[yellow footwear|golden]] [[high heels]]. She also wears [[purple nails|purple]] [[nail polish|nails]], two pairs of [[purple wings]], a [[white belt]] on her [[thigh belt|left thigh]], a [[purple collar|purple]] and [[white collar]] with a [[purple bowtie]], a pair of bowtie-shaped [[earrings]] and a large [[halo]] behind her head. 

She has two cats, a [[black cat|black]] one named [[Mocha (eileennoir)|]] and the [[brown cat|brown]] one called [[Latte (eileennoir)|]]. 
She later revealed that she has a girlfriend called [[Khun Mha (eileennoir)|]] (Thai: คุณหม๋า, Literal meaning: Ms Doog) who is a [[dog girl]].

title: yamamura_hiroki
body:
This artist is a professional animator who worked closely with studio [[Shaft (company)|]] on series such as [[Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei]], [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]], and the [[monogatari (series)|Monogatari series]] mostly as chief animation director.

Prior to that (under the pen-name "Murayama Takahiro") he was the illustrator of ero-games such as [[Usaneko]] and [[GHQ: Chihiro Gakuen Ura Gakuensai]] from about 2003 - 2007.

Before that, he was a doujin artist with the same pen-name styling himself as ""Studio Pakli":[https://kabe-uchiroom.com/mypage/?id=185655283]" and published a few doujinshi with [[Suzuki Amaharu]] in the "Jibaku System" circle and others from about 1999-2003.

title: ibuki_meno
body:
An [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[Virtual Youtuber]], and former 1st batch member of [[Prism Project]]. She's a mecha [[dragon girl]]. She wears a silver metallic coat with a circuit board pattern on it. On her neck, there is a small black bowtie. She wears a short grey skirt that is fastened with a grey belt. She also wears white tights and black boots. Her belly button is exposed. On her back, she has a large metallic tail, that she can detach at any moment. She has dark purple eyes with electronic accents on them. She has very long grey hair that reaches below the knees. On top of her head, she has a pair of light blue holographic horns.

Her voice is very soft and quiet and is very shy, and won't speak during collabs unless she needs to. 

She often refers to herself in third-person, calls her fans "Otagons" and her catchphrase is "Ippui!"

Her character designer is [[siragagaga]].

title: chou_eshi_ten_~if_no_gakkyoku_sekai_ten~
body:
An annual exhibition managed by [[Niconico]] under its [[Niconico Chokaigi]] artist platform that runs during the last full week of April. Its theme is "what would the world look like if the artists were different?", where artists are given a list of themes by [[VOCALOID]] producers based on their songs and must reinterpret them in their own styles.

It features approximately a hundred artists, with four artists each drawing one of the 25 songs available.

title: tri-brigade_nervall
body: A birdman with a [[plague doctor]] aesthetic belonging to the Tri-Brigade [[Duel Monster]] archetype. Without his mask, he has [[white hair|white feather-like hair]] with [[brown_hair|brown highlights]] and [[brown eyes]] with [[bags_under_eyes|bags underneath them]]. His mask is used to see in the dark. He uses drones to assist him. According to his concept art, he loves to drink coffee, even on hot days. Unfortunately, this habit makes him an insomniac.

title: illya_(princess_connect!)
body:
A [[Princess Connect!]] character and a member of the guild Diabolos. She appears in Princess Connect! Re:Dive.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[hair between eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[white leotard|white]] [[strapless leotard]], [[red dress|red]] [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[frilled dress]] with a [[showgirl skirt]], [[fur-trimmed gloves|fur-trimmed]] [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[fur-trimmed_cloak |fur-trimmed]] [[white cloak]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black choker]], and a red [[bonnet]].

She can shift from adult to [[illya (small) (princess connect!)|child]] forms.

h4. Official Costumes/Variants:

title: the_legend_of_zelda:_spirit_tracks
body:
The fifteenth main installment in [[The Legend of Zelda]] series, released in 2009 for the [[Nintendo DS]].

A loose sequel to [[the_legend_of_zelda:_the_wind_waker|The Wind Waker]] and [[the_legend_of_zelda:_phantom_hourglass|Phantom Hourglass]], it features the same toon artstyle.
Notable for being the first mainline game where [[toon_zelda|Zelda]] is playable, supporting [[Link]] in certain sections by taking control of a [[phantom_(zelda)|Phantom]].

title: fingercreeper_(elden_ring)
body: [b]Fingercreepers[/b], also called Spider Hands, are a creature in [[Elden Ring]]. They are giant, [[monster|monstrous]] [[disembodied hand|hand]]s with [[extra digits|extra fingers]], and [[grey skin]], that move like [[spider]]s. One of the central fingers can be adorned with a large, [[gem|jeweled]] [[ring]], or have an imprint of where a ring used to be.

title: tokage_setsuna
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]], a 1st year class B student of the hero school. Known under her hero alias "Lizardy"

She has a "lizard" quirk, which granted her an ability to [[disembodied hand|detach part of her bodies]] and freely control them from distance, as well as capable of regenerating the missing part given some time.

title: ninja_(sonic_frontiers)
body: An enemy entity in [[Sonic Frontiers]]. It is tall, robotic humanoid with arms composed of two [[disembodied hand|disembodied]] blades, which it uses to attack. Its body is almost entirely black aside from its "face" and red stripes across its limbs. Ninja also has what appear to be a [[narrow waist]] and [[wide hips]].

body:

Various [[Disney]] worlds and characters return, and a wide variety of new [[Heartless (kingdom hearts)|]] are featured. title: nobody_(kingdom_hearts)
body:
Main monster enemies in [[Kingdom Hearts II]], resulting from when a strong-willed person loses their heart and is split between their [[Heartless (kingdom hearts)|]] and the remnants of their body and soul. When that person's Heartless and Nobody are defeated, they return to their original selves.

[[Organization XIII]] is a group of thirteen powerful Nobodies who have control over a specific class of lesser Nobodies, generally based upon their weapon and/or specific element. For example, [[axel (kingdom hearts)|Axel]] can use Assassins, while [[Xigbar]] controls Snipers.

title: heartless_emblem
body: Identifying motif of the Emblem [[Heartless (kingdom hearts)|]] in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] JRPG series.  A black Valentine-style heart with an inverted fleur-de-lis at bottom, outlined in red with a barbed "X" across the middle. Typically located in the center of the chest/body or head.

title: ansem_seeker_of_darkness
body:
[[Kingdom Hearts]] character. Refers to a character who is mentioned throughout [[Kingdom Hearts I]] as a wise man who compiled a series of reports detailing how to defeat the [[Heartless (kingdom hearts)|]].

[spoiler]He winds up being the main antagonist of the first game by possessing [[Riku (kingdom hearts)|]]'s body and seeking to open the door to the Realm of Darkness. In [[Kingdom Hearts II]], he is revealed to be [[Master Xehanort]]'s Heartless, and returns in [[kingdom hearts 3d dream drop distance|Dream Drop Distance]] despite his earlier defeat.[/spoiler]

Not to be confused for [[Ansem the Wise]].

title: heartless_(kingdom_hearts)
body:
Recurring antagonistic entities from the [[KINGDOM HEARTS]] JRPG series. They are divided into Purebloods (coalesced darkness) and Emblem Heartless (formed from hearts), with shared and unique visual traits between the two.

h6. Shared Traits

* dark exteriors/"skin"
* simple, [[yellow eyes]]
* jagged mouths
* bent, spiral features
* monstrous appearances

h6. "Pureblood" Traits

* mostly dark
* may have a heart-shaped hole
* either weak- or strong-looking

h6. "Emblem" Traits

* colorful
* [[heartless_emblem|heart-shaped]] symbol on body
* themed ([[Soldier]]s, elemental mages, etc.)

[[Ansem Seeker of Darkness]] is an Emblem Heartless that retained a human form and mind.

If a Heartless is created from a strong-willed person, the discarded body and mind becomes a [[nobody (kingdom hearts)|Nobody]].

title: harpsichord
body:
The harpsichord is a keyboard instrument. Whereas the piano produces sound by striking a set of strings, the harpsichord produces sound by plucking the strings. 

The frame of a harpsichord is often more angular than that of a {{grand_piano|grand piano}}. Some harpsichords have more than one keyboard (such as the instrument in post #4870510).

title: leila_malcal
body:
The female lead of [[Code Geass]] spin-off [[Code Geass: Boukoku no Akito]].

Leila comes from a family of former Britannian aristocrats and she is a military officer in the E.U. Army. She works under Gene Smilas and is [[Hyuuga Akito]]'s superior and the Commander of the W-0 Unit comprised of Japanese teenagers who recklessly plunge into a battlefield where the survival rate is extremely low. They fight for their freedom, so that they can have a country that they can return to that feels like “home”. Thus begins their fight against the adult world. She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]] and pilots a custom [[Alexander (code geass)|Alexander Type-02]].

[spoilers]A young Leila contracted with [[C.C.]] and developed a [[geass]]. However, since Leila doesn't use her geass a lot, and thus the geass is "dormant", it makes her left eye instead have a [[blue eyes|bluish color]].[/spoilers]

Voiced by [[Sakamoto Maaya]].

h4. External links

* "Code Geass Wiki: Leila Malcal":[https://codegeass.fandom.com/wiki/Leila_Malcal]

title: project_upd8
body:
activ8's virtual talent support 'group', supporting independently-affiliated Virtual Talent in exchange for a portion of their earnings.

Spearheaded by [[Kizuna Ai]], with folks even joining squarely because of her, until April 2020, when she was spun-off into her own autonomous subsidiary.

After two years since beginning in June 2018, it was announced, on November 1st, 2020, that the project would disband on December 31st, 2020.

Due to upd8's nature as merely a support group, and not an actual company, much of the talent associated with upd8 just handled themselves, if not by different companies.

title: yuria_(eversoul)
body:
Deuteragonist and currently an unobtainable character from [[Eversoul]], belonging to the [spoiler]Angel[/spoiler] faction.

As Queen of the Kingdom of Solrey, she is one half of the duo that summoned [[savior_(eversoul)|The Savior]] to their time in order to help the Souls fight against a looming threat endangering their world of Eden, alongside [[mephistopheles_(eversoul)|Mephistopheles]]. Due to said summoning, she has lost almost all her power, rendering her unable to participate in actual battles herself. [spoiler]Main Story Chapter 5 reveals her true identity as the Soul "Apollyon", who was said to have brought the apocalypse that humanity tried to run away from after they summoned her.[/spoiler]

Likes doting on Mephi and eating spicy foods.

Her associated artifact is [b]The Fifth Trumpet[/b].

h3. Appearance:
[tn]See post #6002625.[/tn]
She is a beautiful Soul with [[curly hair|curly]] [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She is usually seen with a golden [[headdress]] that acts as her crown. Her costume follows the same color scheme as the Savior and Mephistopheles, with a primarily [[white dress|white]] [[turtleneck]] [[sleeveless]] dress with some golden adornments. She also wears [[white gloves|white]] [[bridal gauntlet|bridal gauntlets]] and golden footwear.

title: mephistopheles_(eversoul)
body:
Tritagonist and an obtainable character from [[Eversoul]], belonging to the Humanlike faction.

Nicknamed "Mephi", she is an artificial Soul created by a scientist named Dr. Faust to pilot one of the nine arks to be used in escaping Earth during an apocalyptic event in the late 24th century. Centuries later, after making a critical mistake that led to the mass death of the humans aboard, the ark made its way back to Earth, which has been recovering with the help of the Souls that remained. She is one half of the duo that summoned [[savior_(eversoul)|The Savior]] to Eden to help them in their crisis, alongside [[yuria_(eversoul)|Queen Yuria]].

Her artifact is [b]Ark Metatron[/b], her own operated Ark to transport the humanity to space prior to the initial apocalypse.

h3. Costumes:
* Ark Operator (default)
* [[mephistopheles_(fluttering_pink_jelly)_(eversoul)|Fluttering Pink Jelly]] (Love Story True Ending costume)
* Comfy School Life ("Everschool!" Limited-time costume)

h3. Appearance:
[tn]See posts: post #5860306 and post #5974250.[/tn]
She is a [[white hair|white-haired]], [[blue eyes|blue-eyed]] girl. Floating above her head is something akin to a [[broken halo]]. She also sports [[low-tied long hair]]. Her clothing follows a similar color scheme as the Savior and Yuria, wearing a primarily [[white dress|white]] [[turtleneck]] dress with [[shoulder cutout|shoulder cutouts]]. Her [[frilled sleeves]] [[sleeves past fingers|go past her fingers]]. Her [[bare legs]] have [[thigh strap|thigh straps]], and since she usually moves around by floating in the air, she is usually seen [[barefoot]].

title: tokugawa_ieyasu
body:
(January 31, 1543 – June 1, 1616)
Historical figure. Born as Matsudaira Takechiyo.

Raised as the political hostage of [[Imagawa Yoshimoto]], he broke off relations after Yoshimoto's death in Okehazama. Renamed himself to Matsudaira Motonobu, then Matsudaira Motoyasu, then assumed the Tokugawa Ieyasu name in 1567.
Co-led the Oda-Tokugawa army in the Battle of Anegawa against the Azai-Asakura army alongside [[Oda Nobunaga]].

Later fought against [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi]] at Komaki and Nagakute (outskirts of [[Nagoya (city)|]]) in 1584 before making peace with Hideyoshi.

After Hideyoshi's death, he led the Eastern Army in the Battle of Sekigahara against the (pro-Toyotomi) Western Army led by [[Ishida Mitsunari]] in 1600.

Became shogun in 1603, and founded the Tokugawa Shogunate which ruled Japan until 1868. This time period is known as the [[Edo Jidai]].

Fictional depictions of Ishida Mitsunari are tagged separately.

h4. See also
* [[Miyamoto Musashi]] - occasionally depicted as Ieyasu's right hand man, though they seems to have no historical relations in real life

title: danganronpa_3_(anime)
body:
[b]Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak Academy[/b] (ダンガンロンパ３ –The End of 希望ヶ峰学園–) is a TV anime series that aired for 25 episodes starting on July 2016, which is being directed by Seiji Kishi at Lerche. It is advertised as the final chapter of the Hope's Peak Saga of the first two games in [[Danganronpa (series)|]].

The anime was split into two Arcs; [i]Side: Future[/i], which told the story of the Future Foundation members being forced into one last Killing Game, and and [i]Side: Despair[/i], which shows how the 77th class of Hope's Peak fell into despair. Both series wrapped up with a finale episode, titled [i]Side: Hope[/i].

Not to be confused with [[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]].

Characters appearing in the [i]Side: Despair[/i] Arc generally wear the [[Hope's Peak Academy School Uniform]].

title: cave
body:
Also known as a cavern, a natural underground space large enough for a human to enter. Caves form naturally by the weathering of rock and they often extend deep underground. The word "cave" can also refer to much smaller openings such as sea caves, rock shelters, and grottos.

title: plants_vs_zombies
body:
Plants vs. Zombies is a tower defense and strategy video game developed and originally published by PopCap Games for Windows and OS X in May 2009.

In Plants vs. Zombies, players take the role of a homeowner in the midst of a zombie apocalypse. To defend their home from zombies, some which have unique abilities, the player uses plants that can fire projectiles at, give "sun" to purchase other plants to help or block the advancing zombies. Players must plan defenses in multiple "lanes" across the home's lawn and should a zombie make it to the house on any lane, the game is over. Director George Fan was inspired to make the game after playing other tower defense titles and desiring to eliminate the typical strategies of sending advancing enemies through mazes of defenses, instead adapting the lane approach to remove this strategy.

title: akizuki_ritsuko
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series. Originally an intern for 765 Production, but later promoted to idol due to lack of idols scouted. She hopes to become a producer herself, and in some games, actually is one. Her cousin [[akizuki ryo|Ryo]] appears in the DS game [i]Dearly Stars[/i] as an idol of 876 Production (and later in Side-M).

She has [[brown eyes]], wears [[glasses]], and her [[brown hair]] is often tied into [[twin braids]].

Voiced by [[Wakabayashi Naomi]].

h4. See also

* "Akizuki Ritsuko on Project-iM@S Wiki":http://www.project-imas.wiki/Ritsuko_Akizuki

body:
An [i][[iDOLMASTER Cinderella Girls|iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]][/i] character in the Cool (Blue Diamond) category. Shiori is an idol who is fond of seashores and the scent of ocean brine. She always is wearing a sun hat, even when performing on stage. loves mermaids, and sometimes uses it as a stage gimmick.

title: himeno_kanon
body:
An [[Idolmaster Side-M]] character, and a member of the unit [[Mofumofuen (idolmaster)|]] with [[Tachibana Shiro (idolmaster)|]] and [[Okamura Nao]]. A 9 year old former fashion model for the childrens' clothing line designed by his father, he becomes an idol to ensure that he can continue to wear cute clothing as he gets older. He has a [[kanon's sister (idolmaster)|younger sister]] to whom he bears an uncanny resemblance. 

To date, he is the shortest idol in the [[idolmaster|series]] at just 125 cm, even smaller than the 128 cm [[Ichihara Nina]]. 

Voiced by [[Murase Ayumu]].

title: akizuki_ryo
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, introduced in the DS game [[Idolmaster Dearly Stars]].

Soft-spoken 15-year-old Ryou is an idol from 876 Productions and cousin of 765 Production's intern-turned-idol, [[Akizuki Ritsuko]]. Ryou is actually a [[otoko_no_ko|boy]]; who, fed up with his lack of a love life and unwanted attention from boys, asked Ritsuko to help turn him into a cool male idol. She then introduced him to [i]876[/i], only to be dressed up as a girl in a desperate attempt to save a show whose actual performer never showed up in time. He becomes part of the unit [[Dearly Stars (idolmaster)|]] for a time.

He appears in [[Idolmaster Side-M]], where he has changed representation from 876 to 315 Productions and now works openly as a male idol, joining the unit [[F-LAGS_(idolmaster)|]]. He is also the only [i]boy[/i], let alone a [[crossdressing]] one, to make appearances in [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]].

Ryou's theme color is mint green, and he is voiced by [[Sanpei Yuuko]]. 

h4. External links

* "Project iM@S Wiki: Ryo Akizuki":http://www.project-imas.wiki/Ryo_Akizuki

title: step!_(idolmaster)
body:
[b]Step![/b] (ステップ!) is the second image song of [[idolmaster cinderella girls|THE IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]]' [[Honda Mio]]. It was originally released in the album [i]"THE IDOLM@STER CINDERELLA GIRLS STARLIGHT MASTER 02 [[tulip (idolmaster)|Tulip]]"[/i] by Columbia Music Entertaiment on May 18, 2016. 

In 2019, artist [[hemoglosso]] made a music video for the song which became widely popular (post #3838401). The video would later spawn various memes and parodies.

title: idolmaster_cinderella_girls_starlight_stage
body:
A free-to-play collectible [[card (medium)|]] and rhythm mobile game and spin-off of [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]].

The game combines much of the existing gacha mechanics of its predecessor with rhythm gameplay and live 3D performances of both [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls|Cinderella Girls]] songs and new ones original to [i]Starlight Stage[/i]. In addition to sharing music and characters, many of the same cards appear in the spin-off with expanded and revised illustrations.

Unlike its parent series, the [[Producer_(idolmaster)|]] works for 346 Production, and the anime original character [[Executive Mishiro]] is it's Executive Director.

[i]Starlight Stage[/i] was co-developed by Cygames and Bandai Namco Entertainment and originally released on September 3rd, 2015 for Android, and on September 10th, 2015 for iOS.

title: kira!_mankai_smile_(idolmaster)
body:
[b]Kira! Mankai Smile[/b] (キラッ!満開スマイル) is the cute-type ending theme for the first season of [i][[idolmaster cinderella girls|THE IDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls]] Theater [/i] anime. It was the first ending theme to air with the series, both web and television, which first aired on April 4th, 2017. The song is performed by a five person [[idol]] unit, and the costume they wear is called [i]Sakura Smile[/i].

On the March 3rd, 2018, the song made its [i][[idolmaster cinderella girls starlight stage|Starlight Stage]][/i] debut. While this version is performed by the same unit, the song was re-cut to fit the game's typical two minute format.
